name: Teetotum Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is perfect if you want to spend some days in Tulum, in a centrally located place, surrounded by friendly staff.
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are simple, but well decorated and clean. They have a nice bar near the entrance with a simple lobby.
reviews.title: Sad to Leave!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Teetotum for 3 nights, and we loved it!
reviews.title: Best Spot in Tulum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the lovely staff, to the gorgeous rooms it was perfect. Previous to booking, Richard was so helpful on the email, giving advice about the area and what to do!
reviews.title: El mejor

reviews.text: We had booked 3 nights as we also wanted to to stay 3 nights on the beach in Tulum. I would recommend doing this to anyone thinking of going, as you experience the town and it's shops and restaurants without having to take a taxi every time!
reviews.title: THe best city every!!
great stay at Teetotum
reviews.text: Just got back from a week stay at Teetotum over NYE and really enjoyed my time there. Nice design esthetic, the rooms are solid, clean and quiet. The food is fresh and delicious (some of the better meals on the trip were here), the staff friendly and warm, and Richard is a terrific host. Though not on the beach, its on the road to the beach, which, since we had a car, proved perfect for us as we had an active vacation (so much to do there). But you can ride bikes to the beach easily, and also walk right into town. Its a place I'll return to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed here for four nights at the start of our 2 week holiday in Tulum - and ended up coming back to spend our final night here too because we loved it so much. Teetotum is such a relaxing, comfortable, friendly place. When we returned one of the staff said 'welcome home' - and it did feel like that.
reviews.title: We loved Teetotum!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Teetotum is perfectly situated for Tulum town - it's nice not being right in the middle of the main drag, but close enough to have easy access to all the bars/restaurants/shops. We borrowed bikes from the hotel to cycle to the amazing beach nearby - the bikes are a great way to see the local area too, and get a bit off the beaten track. Richard also recommended cenotes for us to cycle to, which were beautiful.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food and drink at Teetotum was really good - very fresh, great specials and delicious breakfasts and the restaurant and bar area is a lovely place to hang out.
reviews.title: Rancho Relaxo

reviews.text: Our room was clean and spacious and the bed was very comfortable.
reviews.title: Loved it!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved this place. The bed was firm (thank you!) The shower is spacious and I liked that the entire bathroom was tiled without a shower curtain. Great towels - every hotel should use towels like these - Huge and quite absorbent. Very safe place. Free Wi-Fi, but by this time our iPad wouldn't connect. Problem on our end not on Teetotum's.
reviews.title: Spacious and Functional

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The curtain should be more substantial... although only 3 other rooms are available, you can clearly see through the thin curtains when a light is on in the room. The pillows sucked. Too big and too soft. We like to read in bed and piling these pillows up really didn't give good support to sit up. The wall safe was only large enough for passports and cash. The iPad wouldn't fit.
reviews.title: modern, clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Too bad the tap water is unpurified - we got spoiled during our stay in Oaxaca. Throughout Tulum, the tap water is bad. We would return to this place.
reviews.title: Home Away From Home

reviews.text: it seemed recently decorated, very stylish. run by an new yorker. clean and basic room. very good breakfast. didn't eat dinner there but when i saw the menu i wished i had because it looked good, again, very modern. only drawback is the distance from the beach, but it is right in town.
reviews.title: Not enough time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're traveling to Tulum, do yourself a favor and stay at Teetotum. My husband and I just returned from a week-long trip and were genuinely sad to leave as much for our wonderful experience at this boutique hotel, as for the glorious natural beauty of the town itself.
reviews.title: Best chile rellenos on the planet plus more...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When visiting Tulum, you have two options - staying right on the beach, or in the town (which is around 2 miles away). Teetotum is certainly the best option in town, as it is tucked away from the main street (which is not the most desirable location - being more like a truck stop than the quaint little village that you might expect) on the road that leads to a spectacular beach. The concept is four rooms, attached to a very cool, hip bar/restaurant. The atmosphere is very laid back and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast is simple (just fruit & toast) and for the price you might expect a little bit more. Lunch and Dinner are well prepared and there are great daily specials. The rooms are stylish, in a minimalist way - but perfect for the beach/hippy environment of Tulum. One of the big positives are the complimentary bicycles - which you can take to explore the area. Teetotum's location is perfect for those wanting to not just go to the beach - but also visit the Mayan Ruins, Cenotes and wonderful nature that Tulum is famous for. Richard (the Owner) has certainly created something unique to the area and Teetotum is a shining star within the town.
reviews.title: Relaxed, friendly and hip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from staying at Teetotum and we were very happy with everything. I'm not saying it is overly fancy, but it was everything we wanted and needed and we would go back again and again.
reviews.title: Our funky getaway in Tulum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had only stopped in for breakfast but when we saw the rooms and how fresh smelling, clean and cool the rooms were we were taken. Then we saw the safe, mini fridge, air conditioning and shower and we were sold.
reviews.title: Great location, cozy rooms, friendly people and good times

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We grabbed a cab and checked out of our current hotel on a fabulous beach and asked the cab driver to wait while we grabbed our bags and returned to Teetotum.
reviews.title: Good option in Tulum

reviews.text: We had been away from home for 2 weeks and it was time we had swam together as we had our passports safely locked in the room safe.
reviews.title: Very Clean, Fun, Family Friendly

description: Teetotum is a small laid back boutique hotel situated in Tulum, in Mexico's Caribbean Riviera Maya. Because of the design, amenities, and ambiance, Teetotum exists as a unique hotel experience. The modern, sleek space and attention to detail, from the handcrafted bench on your private patio to the fresh squeezed tropical juice at breakfast, create a hip atmosphere of comfort and relaxation. On the road to the beach, Teetotum lies just off Tulum Pueblo's lively main street, and a stones throw from Tulum's magnificent white sand Caribbean beaches.
